unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions

Class RetreatPositionCluster

  • java.lang.Object
    • unitControlModule.stateFactories.actions.executableActions.RetreatPositionCluster

  • public class RetreatPositionCluster
extends java.lang.Object
    RetreatPositionCluster.java --- A Class for storing retreat Positions / Points as well as generating them. It stores the members and generates a matrix with RetreatPositionClusterElement for each member. The generation of these elements is handled in a generation function.
    This function uses three Vectors:
    • The Vector from the actual members to the leader Unit and therefore the direction from the former to the latter.
    • One direction Vector on the X-Axis that is used for generating the coordinate of the final Point.
    • One direction Vector on the Y-Axis that is used for generating the coordinate of the final Point.
    The last two are the directionVectorX and directionVectorY properties of this Class.
    Author:
    P H - 19.08.2017

    • Constructor Detail

      • RetreatPositionCluster

        public RetreatPositionCluster(RetreatUnit leader,
                              Point leaderPosition,
                              int distanceBetweenUnits,
                              int matrixTurnAngleXDEG,
                              int matrixTurnAngleYDEG,
                              RetreatPositionValidator retreatPositionValidator)
        Parameters:
        leader - the Unit that is the leader of the cluster. Mainly used for determining the direction to other Units for a more accurate choosing of retreat Positions.
        leaderPosition - the Position around which the other ones are being created around.
        distanceBetweenUnits - the distance that is kept between the different retreat Positions.
        matrixTurnAngleXDEG - the angle at which the X-direction Vector of the retreat Position generator is being turned.
        matrixTurnAngleYDEG - the angle at which the Y-direction Vector of the retreat Position generator is being turned.
        retreatPositionValidator - the validator that is being used for verifying any generated retreat Positions.

    • Method Detail

      • generateMatrix

        private RetreatPositionClusterElement[][] generateMatrix()
        Function for generating a new matrix of RetreatPositionClusterElements with already initialized elements and assigned Points. The current radius is taken into account when generating a new matrix. Also this function does NOT copy any existing references. It is only returning a new matrix without any assigned Units.
        Returns:
        a newly generated matrix of RetreatPositionClusterElements.

      • countInvalidPositions

        private int countInvalidPositions()
        Function for counting all invalid Points of the current cluster elements.
        Returns:
        the number of cluster elements that contain an invalid Point.

      • addUnit

        public void addUnit(RetreatUnit retreatUnit)
        Function for adding a new Unit to the cluster of RetreatPositionClusterElements. The Unit is assigned to a Point that it can retreat to.
        Parameters:
        retreatUnit - the Unit that is added to the cluster of retreat Units.

      • checkCapacity

        private void checkCapacity()
        Function for checking the capacity of the matrix and increasing it's size if necessary.

      • extractClosestFreeClusterElement

        private RetreatPositionClusterElement extractClosestFreeClusterElement(Point appliedDirectionPoint)
        Function for extracting the closest free cluster element from the available ones in the matrix. This function takes the current direction of the Unit to the stored leader into account to find the most appropriate RetreatPositionClusterElement whose stored Point is the closest one to the end of the applied Vector.
        Parameters:
        appliedDirectionPoint - the Point which resembles the direction of the Unit to the leader applied to the leader's stored RetreatPositionClusterElement Point. The closest free, valid cluster element is the one the Unit must be assigned to.
        Returns:
        the cluster element that is most suited for the Unit to be assigned to.

      • increaseCapacity

        private void increaseCapacity()
        Function for increasing the capacity of the matrix. This is done by increasing the radius and copying all existing references into the new matrix.

      • updateSizeMax

        private void updateSizeMax()
        Function for updating the information regarding the maximum number of Units the matrix can store.

      • display

        public void display()
        Function for displaying the matrix onto the map.
        • Free space: Green
        • Occupied space: Orange
        • Invalid space: Red

      • containsRetreatUnit

        public boolean containsRetreatUnit(RetreatUnit retreatUnit)
        Function for checking if the specified Unit is already part of the cluster.
        Parameters:
        retreatUnit - the Unit that will be checked for.
        Returns:
        true if the Unit is already part of the cluster, false if it is not.

      • getAssignedPosition

        public Point getAssignedPosition(RetreatUnit retreatUnit)
        Function for returning the Point that the given Unit is assigned to.
        Parameters:
        retreatUnit - the Unit whose assigned Point is being retrieved.
        Returns:
        The Point that the Unit was assigned to or null if the Unit was not mapped to a Point.
